Psychology_414_p$Psychology_214_r$Psycho.text:
Finding A: Compared with women with no depression, women with a history of depression had a subsequent increased risk of SLE (HR, 2.67; 95% CI, 1.91-3.75; P < .001).
Finding B: The researchers found that closing the eyes helped the participants remember both audial and visual information.
Finding C: Here, we show that riluzole can protect against some of the synaptic alterations in hippocampus that are linked to age-related memory loss in rats.
Finding D: This would provide evidence for a neuroanatomical signature of schizophrenia expressed above and beyond ethnic differences in incidence and clinical expression.

Psychology_179_p$Psychology_tweet_120_p$.text:
Finding A: Early pseudomature behavior also predicted higher adult levels of more serious criminal behavior, alcohol and drug use, and problems associated with such use.
Finding B: Simple slope analyses indicated that high-SOI participants who had casual sex over the academic year had higher self-esteem (B ¼ 0.14, SE ¼ 0.06, p ¼ .025) and marginally lower depression (B ¼ À0.12, SE ¼ 0.07, p ¼ .091) and anxiety (B ¼ À0.11, SE ¼ 0.06, p ¼ .086) than high-SOI participants who did not have casual sex (Figure 3) .
Finding C: In the context of the chaotic environment combined with an out-of-control mindset, increased cookie consumption might have been the result of depleted selfregulatory strength from managing one\'s emotions under such conditions.
Finding D: algorithmic reflections of behavior still result in identity shift effects. this paper found that behaviorally targeted advertising can influence self-perceptions through implied social labels\n

Psychology_tweet_170_p$Psychology_tweet_.text:
Finding A: We found that social media use is not, in and of itself, a strong predictor of life satisfaction across the adolescent population.
Finding B: CONCLUSIONS Twelve months of TE+IMP were more effective than placebo in preventing the development of clinically significant depressive symptoms among initially euthymic perimenopausal and early postmenopausal women.
Finding C: Risk for #tic disorders, including #Tourette syndrome, increased w/ degree of #genetic relatedness.
Finding D: "Contrary to previous studies, we have shown that the prevalence of autism spectrum conditions in China is in line with that found in the West," said Dr Sophia Xiang Sun, who conducted this study as part of her PhD at Cambridge University and who is now based in the Star Kay Bridge Research Centre for Children with Autism in Xiamen, China.

Psychology_35_p$Psychology_tweet_4_r$Psy.text:
Finding A: The prevalence estimate indicates that the prevalence of autism in China is similar to estimates in Western countries.
Finding B: Eye diseases have been linked to the development of Alzheimer\'s disease in a new study. Glaucoma, age-related macular degeneration, and diabetic retinopathy were associated with increased Alzheimer\'s...
Finding C: Re-exposure to Dutch words during sleep improved later memory for the German translation of the cued words when compared with uncued words.
Finding D: What\'s more, "risk was particularly high for infantile autism before age 5 years."

Psychology_tweet_15_r$Psychology_tweet_1.text:
Finding A: Using a "Positive Deviance" Framework to Discover Adaptive Risk Reduction Behaviors among High-Risk #HIV Negative Black Men Who Have Sex with Men [a] HT @username #MSM #BMSM #SexualHealth #Sexuality #SexualBehavior #SRH #GUM #SRHR
Finding B: always wanted to discuss circumcision on #autism boards? Here is your chance
Finding C: An innovative brain imaging study has uncovered new evidence explaining why ToM deficiencies are present in ASD children.
Finding D: Given expectations for continued growth in the number of young adults with an ASD entering adulthood, urgent consideration should be given to employment preparation that is consistent with the current labor market in order to facilitate employment and minimize costs to society.

Psychology_402_r$Psychology_tweet_237_p$.text:
Finding A: The researchers suggest that women who reported more PTSD symptoms were more likely to have food addiction when measured via the Yale Food Addiction Scale, which assess dependency on food.
Finding B: This would provide evidence for a neuroanatomical signature of schizophrenia expressed above and beyond ethnic differences in incidence and clinical expression.
Finding C: In contrast, paternal age showed a U-shaped relationship, with the offspring of teenaged fathers having a 28% increased risk for a psychiatric disorder (IRR, 1.28 [95% CI, 1.24-1.32]), whereas the offspring of the fathers 45 years or older had a 34% increased risk (1.34 [1.30-1.39]).
Finding D: In addition to high levels of internalizing problems, adolescents with binge-eating disorder also had high levels of suicide attempt and ideation.

Finding C: In contrast, paternal age showed a U-shaped relationship, with the offspring of teenaged fathers having a 28% increased risk for a psychiatric disorder (IRR, 1.28 [95% CI, 1.24-1.32]), whereas the offspring of the fathers 45 years or older had a 34% increased risk (1.34 [1.30-1.39]).
Finding D: In addition to high levels of internalizing problems, adolescents with binge-eating disorder also had high levels of suicide attempt and ideation.

Psychology_tweet_8_r$Psychology_454_r$Ps.text:
Finding A: In-school music training in adolescence might accelerate neurodevelopment and improve literacy. (£)
Finding B: Together, these findings suggest that competence and masculinity are correlated components of first impressions based on appearance.
Finding C: "Tibetan singing bowl meditation ( may be a feasible low-cost technology for reducing feelings of tension, anxiety and depression in individuals who have not previously practiced this form of meditation." (University of California)\n
Finding D: Conclusions: The findings suggest that gender differences in the application of intoxication terms are other-directed as well as self-directed and that intoxication language can inform gender-specific prevention and intervention efforts targeting problematic alcohol use among college students.

Finding A: These findings provides a neural basis for understanding how depression is associated with poor sleep quality, and this in turn has implications for treatment because of the brain areas identified.
Finding B: In summary, odor labels affect pleasantness ratings and edibility perception.
Finding C: "These findings show the need both for clinicians to pay particular attention to patients reporting experience of psychotic experience, and for greater funding for research into recognizing a psychosis subtype of suicide," he continued.
Finding D: This positive link between the intensity of daily hassles on a given day and the probability of having sexual intercourse on the subsequent day was only significant for women high on relationship satisfaction, g ¼ .26, p ¼ .0024, but not for women low on relationship satisfaction, g ¼ .15, p ¼ .14.
